instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the related study to monitor the freshness of spinach leaves during storage at different temperatures and durations?
Output: In the related study, two kinds of spectra were used: visible near-infrared reflectance (Vis-NIR) spectra (380-1030 nm) and near-infrared reflectance (NIR) spectra (874-1734 nm).

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related study to monitor the freshness of spinach leaves during storage at different temperatures and durations?
Output: PCA was conducted on spectral reflectance, second-order derivative spectra were used for the selection of effective wavelengths, and PLS-DA, SVM, and ELM models were established using full spectra and effective wavelengths.

instruction: How were machine learning models utilized in the related study to monitor the freshness of spinach leaves during storage at different temperatures and durations?
Output:
In the study, machine learning models were utilized to monitor the freshness of spinach leaves during storage at different temperatures and durations. The researchers used three different machine learning models: Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (PLS-DA), Support Vector Machine (SVM), and Extreme Learning Machine (ELM).

These models were built based on the full spectra and effective wavelengths obtained from the hyperspectral imaging systems. The full spectra and effective wavelengths were used as input features for the machine learning models.

The researchers evaluated the performance of the models by measuring their accuracy in identifying the freshness of spinach leaves. The accuracy of the models was assessed using both the visible near-infrared reflectance (Vis-NIR) spectra and the near-infrared reflectance (NIR) spectra.

All three machine learning models achieved good results, with accuracies above 92% for both the Vis-NIR spectra and NIR spectra. The ELM model obtained the best results, with all accuracies reaching 100%.

Overall, the study demonstrated the potential of using machine learning models, specifically PLS-DA, SVM, and ELM, in identifying the freshness of spinach leaves preserved at different temperatures and durations using hyperspectral imaging systems.
